newsitem.title: USA: Halliburton to realign business segments.
newsitem.headline: Halliburton to realign business segments.

text.p: Halliburton Co said on Tuesday it will realign business units within its two segments during the 1996 fourth quarter in order to better meet the growing customer needs for integrated energy services.
Halliburton's Brown & Root unit will be split up, with Brown & Root energy services divided from Brown & Root's engineering and construction services.
The Brown & Root energy services will be restructured to include Halliburton's traditional energy services businesses, Halliburton said.
Halliburton said it plans to complete the acquisition of Landmark Graphics in October 1996, which will also be integrated into the energy services businesses.

Halliburton's energy services unit will also integrate Brown & Root Energy Services engineering, construction and project management capabilities with Halliburton Energy Services' subsurface expertise, Halliburton said.
